intro: Rinorea albicaulis, commonly known as the white-stemmed rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, white-veined leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in moist, shaded forest environments. Rinorea albicaulis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
